Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of a Multimodal Delirium Prevention Intervention in Older Surgical Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a stepped-wedge cluster randomised trial

Participants.evidence: patients aged 70 years and older undergoing elective orthopedic, general, or cardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: The intervention comprised structured delirium education for caregivers and daily assessment of patient delirium risk factors, with tailored prevention strategies.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the efficacy of a multifaceted intervention in reducing postoperative delirium incidence and duration.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative delirium incidence, assessed daily for seven days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors and patients were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: the study included 1470 patients aged 70 years and older undergoing elective orthopedic, general, or cardiac surgery from November 2017 to April 2019.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 1470 patients, 763 (51.9%) were male, with a median age of 77 years.
